Reviews.Title: “Good quality service at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to visit Montreal and stayed at this place for 2 nights. The hotel was good quality with soft-spoken and caring staff. The rooms were clean and prepared well. Truly a star for under 100 bucks. The parking though is an adventure in itself. They share a 3 level underground parking with another hotel and navigating the bends inside it is something you may not be prepared for. Although there are other options to park your vehicle which are equally economical. Good place overall...

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: drcalm1
Reviews.Content: Large comfortable room, comfortable beds. Just fridge in our room, not full kitchenette(which we knew). Needed A/C for heat wave in March, and was fixed promptly when it would not turn on at first. Nice TV. Found it very quiet, did not here any noise from other guests and were near elevator on 4th floor. Heard slight traffic noise from big trucks/buses, but window seemed quite soundproof. Nice room darkening curtains.Breakfast was good, pleasant attendant, nice pastries and bagels from local bakery(not mass produced dough bomb bagels) in basement, but with windows so some natural light. Used garage which is ok with small car, good driving/parking skills and willingness to climb stairs(no elevator);secure. Great location, can walk to downtown/old montreal, old port, chinatown,latin quarter, or use Metro/bus. Would stay again, not fancy, but met our needs, clean and felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: pleplayplait
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute and based on other ratings. At the end of our three night stay I felt the hotel was average but will probably not stay there again if I return to Montreal because the walls were so thin. I have outlined the good and bad things about the hotel below so that others can make an informed decision. THE GOOD - The hotel's webiste noted that they had changed over all their beds in 2011 and I can't say I had any complaints. The bed was comfortable. - The suite looked clean (save the beginning of mildew in the caulking in a small spot around the tub) - The staff was courteous - The hotel is a short walk (1 block) away from the Berri UQAM metro stop. - Our suite had a kitchenettes that were fully equipped with dishes, dish soap, toaster, coffee maker, stove, fridge, sink, dish cloths etc. (Ideal if you are travelling with people with dietary restrictions or on a tight budget) THE SO SO - Continental Breakfast wasn't very large: bread, a few pastries, half bagels (yes I said half) prewrapped, canned fruit, only plain oatmeal, cornflakes or fruit loops, and prepackaged muffins. - The hotel seemed like it was about two blocks away from a scarier part of town. There was evidence of graffiti in the area. - Parking. We paid $17.25 (taxes included) to park in the garage of the hotel next door only to find out getting in and out of that garage with a larger than average car proved to be quite a challenge. If you drive anything bigger than a Toyota Corolla, Honda civic or Ford Focus I wouldn't advise it. -The price- While it was not bad for the area, I have paid less to stay in nicer places. - The size of the bed- I don't tknow if they were using a different sizing chart but that "queen sized" bed looked very much like a double to me. THE BAD -The Walls are paper thin. I could clearly hear the conversations of the poeple in the room next to mine. I had a hard time sleeping because of late night and early morning converations, and loud music coming from the room next to mine in the three nights I was there. - The fridge was old and noisy. When other guests weren't keeping me awake the fridge in our suite took over. - The fold out bed-There were three of us traveling so each of us slept on the fold out couch one night. While the actual bed was comfortable the fold out was a recipe for tossing, turning and a cricked neck. I wouldn't recommend anyone sleep on it. Overall, I think I would have had a better impression this hotel had I been able to get a good nights sleep instead of hearing my neighbours conversations all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Tanya_Gabe
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay at Le Roberval for our conference in Montreal was just fine. We got a great deal on Expedia, and it was well worth it. The hotel is located very close to the subway station and the bus station, so it is easy to get to lots of Montreal sites and is also easy to take the 737 bus to/from the airport. The hotel is also located close to lots of restaurants (Rue St.-Denis), and if you are up for walking, you can walk to lots of other places in the city (or take the subway if you aren't). Our room was clean. It had two small closets, a refrigerator, hair dryer, flat screen TV. No dresser though, so we couldn't really put our clothes away. We were given an iron/ironing board when we asked for one. The hotel is on a relatively busy street, so I was afraid it would be noisy at night. I was pleasantly surprised that I didn't hear too much traffic. But the hotel walls are pretty thin, and the pipes are loud, so we did hear some indoor noise. The breakfast was not too exciting (2 kinds of cereal, yogurt, croissants, toast, bagels, muffins, canned fruit, juice, coffee, tea), but it was free, and had enough food to tide us over until lunchtime. The options never changed though, by our 4th morning, we were wanting more variety. The staff was polite. The internet was fast and free. The room temperature was comfortable. If you are looking a reasonably priced place to sleep while you explore Montreal, I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to city centre”
Reviews.Author: antohny
Reviews.Content: Simple and comfortable clean rooms. Very polite staff. I like the location, is only one block from subway. Only the breakfast was terible.

Reviews.Title: “Price/ quality good balanced”
Reviews.Author: 155019Eric
Reviews.Content: Price/ quality good balanced You get what you pay for. Rooms are smaller that might seem to you on the pictures but they have everything you might need.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Downtown, MontrÃ©al”
Reviews.Author: shirazk
Reviews.Content: We booked here for a new year's weekend 2011 and were very pleased. This is not a fancy hotel by any means, however because it was formerly an apartment building, the rooms are very spacious and well-equipped for the price! Perfect for staying with families or friends. The hotel staff were very kind and quickly attended to some special requests we made. Rooms were very clean and furnished well, however the bathrooms were small (like an apartment bathroom). Also, the walls seemed thin as you could hear noise from the hallway and adjacent rooms if someone was being loud. The breakfast was good, but if you get there near then end of serving time, dont' expect there to be much left. The only other negative point would be the parking. They charge $15 per day to park in their private garage which is just down the street from the hotel. But because of the amazing location of the hotel, we never had to take out the car once during the entire trip. EVERYTHING was walking distance (Old Port / Old Montreal, Subway, Restaurants, etc.) Overall, you get amazing value out of this hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “WORST MOTEL I HAVE STAYED EVER, NEVER try to book here!”
Reviews.Author: Sam L
Reviews.Content: WORST MOTEL i checked in ever for several reason: i) i call in and book the motel at a special rate, but on the day of check out they said they can't give me that rate and have to charge me a standard rate, $60 more, they just want to rip you off, and I can see argument over the counter with another customer as well.........not being suprised i am arguing with them as well ii) poor ventilation at night, i ask them if you can turn on the heat a little more, they told me instead to OPEN the window up...............finally they take 2 fans to my room in 45 min iii) parking--you have to pay extra and it's ok............but the underground parking is damn narrow and you need extreme good driving skills to park in............ you better stay away from this motel to avoid to mess your trip up............

Reviews.Title: “Good Price Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: My positive experience started before I booked with the Hotel Le Roberval. Before booking I wrote to the hotel to inquire about parking space/size. They were kind enough to advise that our car would not fit in their parking lot but there was a surface lot just down the block we could use. When we arrived the young man at reception was very friendly and gave us great advise on where to find a 'real beer' bar in the area and did not mind speaking English (when needed). I liked that we were near the IGA store so we could stock up on a few things like wine, cheese, bread, pate, fruit, etc. and use the in-room fridge to avoid the cost of some meals in restaurants. One thing we were not thrilled with, but had no problems with, was the park next to the metro entrance was filled with many young street people loiterring around and they were doing a large feeding of homeless people each evening. Watch your pockets and valuables and it was fine. The room was large, two queen beds, but the lighting was poor. Need more down lighting for reading by the beds and stronger watt bulbs wouldn't hurt. The rooms were clean, shower worked well and the lighting in the bathroom was good for shaving and make-up application. Windows were well insulated and kept most of the city noise out. The heat in the room kept going up even though we kept trying to lower it. The heating was quite and the seperate heater and thermostat in the bathroom was nice to have. We were going to call about the heat but decided not to since we were in bed and didn't want someone coming to the room when we were in our pj's. I'm sure they would have dealt with it efficiently since they handled all other enquiries well (the staff were friendly and helpful with all the clientelle that I saw while waiting in the lobby). The free WiFi and desk in the room made it easy to use the computer to check local attractions, etc. It was nice to have an elevator but it could be a bit poky when people were going down to the breakfast room. The free breakast was simple and adequate, nothing special to write about. Big bonus for me was the little luggage cart that I could take outside to load/unload the car and it fit in the narrow hallways and elevator without a struggle. The walk to the Latin Quarter, Chinatown and Vieux Montreal was easy from this hotel and the metro with great connections was just minutes away. If you want the nicer shopping on Rue St. Catherine, you need to take the metro to McGill or Peel stops, which are about 4 stops away from the station near the hotel. We did have some confusion with purchasing a metro ticket but the majority of the staff were very helpful and willing to speak English. We did enjoy the shops in the area of the hotel that sold books and magazines (which we came to Montreal to buy) so we didn't have to carry them far. I will definitely book again and recommend to others for location and good value.

Reviews.Title: “helpful and attentive”
Reviews.Author: iffy58
Reviews.Content: The Le Roberval is in a central location, one block from the subway and within walking distance of the old town. The staff were very attentive to our needs and changed rooms for us when I said we needed two beds rather then one. Also, we loved having the kitchen right there in the room. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean, roomy, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jiang L
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 1 toddler) stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. The one bedroom suite is a great choice for us. We appreciate everything from the sofabed in the living room to the lovely kitchen with stoves, oven, full-size refrigerator, glass plates and stainless steel utensils. The hotel is so thoughtful that they prepare dishwash soap and kitchen towels for us to use. The location is also great. We can easily walk around and enjoyed the restaurants on St. Paul street. The IGA grocery store is two blocks away. We cooked fresh shrimps and vegetables. My toddler enjoyed her steamed broccoli a lot. The free breakfast is another highlight. It was raining for three days. Having the breakfast in the basement saved us a lot of time and energy to go outside early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: cab28
Reviews.Content: Convienently located, good price, and very well kept hotel. Friendly staff and good breakfast included. I would stay here again. Parking garage entrance/exit was difficult. Glad I had a very small car!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Larry S
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Roberval--and I expect to stay again in the future! I stayed in a small suite--very comfortable, with a nice little kitchen area which separated the bedroom and the small living room. The staff was very polite and helpful (e.g., on a previous visit I had left some shirts behind and they were quite helpful in taking care of the situation and giving them to a friend who came by for them.) On this visit, I had to cancel my first night because of inclement weather and the manager was very helpful in seeing that I was not charged for the canceled night. The location is excellent (a block from a major Metro station). There is a decent breakfast included (cereal, toast, buns, fruit). Overall a pleasant stay at a reasonable cost!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff / parking a little scary”
Reviews.Author: jrh27012
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself seemed dated but clean. The room was nice and large with a microwave and fridge which was really nice. Free WiFi was a nice plus too. The location was great for walking around Old Montreal, convenient to restaurants, and close to the metro. We saw a few homeless people around but it was a non-issue. The staff helped us find places to eat, drew maps for us, explained how to get to the various points we wanted to visit, and were very willing to help in any way they could. They always had a great attitude when answering all our questions. Their English was quite good - much better than our French!! The breakfast was very adequate and the area was clean and was kept restocked by a very nice staff person. The parking was the only big negative. It's expensive and across the street in a garage with a really sharp curve going down into it and it was steep too. We had a small/medium sized car and had to back up to make the curve without hitting the wall - it's way too tight and scary. I don't know what would have happened if we had met someone else coming / going. The walls had lots of marks from cars who didn't make the curve........We didn't dare move the car until we were ready to leave the city. Aside from this, it was a great value for the money and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better...great free Wi-Fi, though”
Reviews.Author: JB-Global
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Le Roberval four times over the past 8 years, most recently earlier this month in September 2011. The location is still great (one long block from the Berri-UQAM Metro station) and the hotel staff is very courteous and helpful. Hotel Le Roberval also has free, extremely rocket-fast Wi-Fi, exclusively for hotel guests. For travelers from outside Canada who wish to access the Internet from their smartphones and not incur roaming charges, this alone is invaluable. I must say, though, that I believe the quality is starting to slip, compared to my earlier visits. The continental breakfast is depressing...the bread was stale tasting, and they've apparently changed the supplier of coffee to a less exceptional roaster. Towels are worn. Room air conditioners chug along, looking and sounding like they are ready to call it a life at any minute. If you can get a good room rate, you may be more satisfied. But if you can't, you'll feel you didn't get a good value. I'm hoping that over time, the hotel can make some upgrades that will restore Le Roberval to being excellent. The location and the staff (the hard part) are great; a few minor tweaks to refresh the rooms (and the coffee) will go a long way to cultivating loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families but need improvement”
Reviews.Author: shattawak
Reviews.Content: At dirst, we were kindly surprised by the roberbal. We went there my husband and I with a 2 years old baby and my parents from june30 to july 3, 2011. The 2 rooms were nice and really clean with a kitchen. My little family get a full kitchen in the room. Location is perfect in downtown and the old port. We event saw the fireworks from our window. But.... My husband had to change his keys 2 night in a row times cause they didn't work. While we were there, the air conditioner broke in my parents room. In our room, we didn't use the air conditioner because it was really noisy and old. We could not control the temperature at all. too cold for a baby. This was summer with a baby. We suffer! I complained at the lobby. they repaired my parents air cond but they told me to put a towel on the air cond. Even with this Mac Gyver solution, was still too cold. The hotel has been revamped but not the air con!We opened the window but the streets were noisy and we were hot. The breakfast not so good. Cold things. For the price paid, I already had better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place,excellent food!”
Reviews.Author: collins l
Reviews.Content: WOnderful place to stay in.great people at the front desk.great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great for family stay”
Reviews.Author: TanLL
Reviews.Content: We had 3 adults n a toddler.so the amount of space was gd.bathroom was a bit small n noisy. The place requires extensive upkeep.showing signs of being run down as during our visit, the tap from the bath fell off and the oven did not work. However, the repairs were done very quickly.The cleaning crew were very kind. Would choose to stay somewhere in next visit to montreal.area not very safe cos of drunks.

Reviews.Title: “The suite was sweet for our family.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferRV
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a toddler, we like having two rooms and a kitchenette. This is hard to find on our budget. The Roberval met our needs for space, cost, comfort and location. Our room was perfect as the living room and bedroom were separated by a galley kitchen and bathroom. This allowed us to put our son to bed in the living room while we could still use the bathroom and bedroom without disturbing him. The room could have been cleaner - needed detailing. The tub drain was full of hair. Dining table was sticky and the corners under the cabinets were full of crumbs. Bed was surprisingly comfortable. Our room only had one bedside table/reading lamp. [and the bulb was out when we arrived] Love that it had free wifi. Surprised to find some large chain hotels still charge for that. The breakfast was sufficient and met our needs. Bread, croissants, muffins, cereals/oatmeal. Canned fruit, yogurt, juice/milk and coffee. We like toast with peanut butter, croissants, yogurt so we were satisfied. Staff should have recommended the side entrance that had a ramp and a luggage cart. We discovered it the day before leaving. On our arrival date, we were parked by it unknowingly, carried 9 pieces of luggage around the corner and up two sets of stairs. Then transferred it all in shifts to elevator as we were told there was no trolley/cart. The issue there was English/French with the staffer on duty. Other staffers were proficient in English through our stay. The location was perfect for us as we wanted to explore Vieux Montreal, the Latin Quarter and visit the Biodome. While we are from NYC, we were struck by the number of homeless folks across the street and down the block on St. Denis towards the river. There is quite a bit of tourist traffic coming and going from Vieux Montreal so it's busy and safety probably isn't an issue. Unfortunately, I was followed while pushing my son in the stroller for a couple blocks by a man yelling obscenities at me. I caught up with my husband and went into a store. However, I never felt unsafe coming and going from our immediate building at the Roberval.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all - Friendly staff, best location”
Reviews.Author: saurav2kx
Reviews.Content: Good place, you just have to be a bit tolerant and not have too many expectations... staff is good, decent breakfast. Some amenities are only available on request. Location is great, 5 min walk to Berry Uqam Metro which is a junction of all lines.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, clean lobby and room, less than helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mcinnese
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the room was roomy and well appointed for the price (fridge, coffee maker, toaster, cutlery and plates) and the windows open wide. The location is central but the neighbourhood is a little shady - there are homeless around and you will likely be hit up for change, but neither my wife nor I ever felt threatened or unsafe. The hotel is on a major street and if you like to sleep with the window open then you may very well find it too loud. Personally, we were there in August and we had the air conditioner running and the window closed. Breakfast is nothing to get excited about - breads and fruit and yogourt. For the price though I wasn't unhappy. The staff was friendly but CLUELESS about the area. I had three questions during my stay and the desk had no answer for any of them and it was different people each time. The parking lot that they recommend at the desk was closed for construction which they didn't know about (clerk said that he'd never been there and it's literally around the corner) and then they could not direct me to any other lot (there are several within a couple of blocks including a couple visible from the hotel). They could not direct me to the nearest (or ANY) convenience type store (again, many in the area). They could not direct me to any bagel shop, anywhere in the city. Come on, it's Montreal! I wouldnâ€™t be totally against staying here again if it suited my plans but I would probably consider other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, good breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: Baronming
Reviews.Content: It's like a small appartement , and the breakfast is a continental breakfast where can serve as you want. Near the Old Montreal, and close to the Ste-Catherine street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: dianes51
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about 1 km from the convention centre and Old Montreal where we spent most of our time. We had a family suite which was spacious and clean with two air-conditioned bedrooms. The bathroom was tiny and there was only one mirror in the whole suite which made getting ready a bit challenging for us. The decor is adequate but a bit tired, and could use a few minor repairs and paint. Our room included continental breakfast which was fine but the same every day - could be improved with the addition of cheese and eggs, and/or different pastries instead of the same thing every day. The staff is friendly and helpful but the housekeeping could use improvement. We noticed food crumbs on the floor were not swept up and our hotel room door was left open by the maid which did not make us feel very comfortable although there was nothing missing. Overall, a decent place to stay- not fancy but clean and well situated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: tynewell
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and the hotel service was excellent. We enjoyed our stay very much. Morning continental breakfast was nice with staff continuously cleaning and adding to the breakfast supplies. The hotel is in an excellent location for either walking to old town and other downtown sites, as well as a great location for the metro subway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: work4worldtravel
Reviews.Content: So many homeless people on the block made us uncomfortable, but our room was worse. The place is a dump. The bed may be new, but the blankets and sheets were old and full of holes. The a/c wasn't even in the bedroom of the suite. We overheard another customer complain - the staff was indifferent and the manager downright rude. Reading other reviews, you could make a mistake and think they care about their customers. Find someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maarteke
Reviews.Content: This is overall a decent hotel. There was quite a lot of noise from outside. Also, the fridge in the room wasn't the quietst either. The breakfast buffet was okay. The hotel has a very good location. right in the quartier Latin (lots of bars and restaurants nearby) it has a subway stop nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Small hotel and Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: BJames10Toronto
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, centrally located and clean and comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: Simsonic
Reviews.Content: Paid about $105 US for the room. It was okay. Near the Village (Latin Quarter) and can walk to Old Montreal. Safe in the hotel. Not a luxury hotel by any means, but not a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at low price, near to lively part of town and to centre.”
Reviews.Author: jesu1411
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is conveniently located near the livelier student and entertainment district of Montreal, and the centre is also very accessible, even by foot. It is also close to the Metro, for convenient and efficient access to all other key parts of town. Facilities: The hotel itself was of surprisingly good quality for the price and the room was very good. The staff were very helpful and even let us store our baggage for the day after we had checked out. The breakfast was great, with Continential options of croissants and pastries included. There was no noise from the street at all, but the corridors can sometimes be noisy in late morning when customers are wheeling their suitcases around. I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: travel_g3
Reviews.Content: I had an overall positive experience. I encountered very friendly staff who were always helpful and fluent in English. The room was bigger than expected and was clean. I didn't have a problem with noise either. I was pleased with my stay and will revisit again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zvc
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, good service. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. I stayed there with my Mom who also found this hotel very good, especially rooms and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for students on a budget”
Reviews.Author: amo1234321
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend, and really liked the hotel. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean, though a bit out-dated, and the rooms were quite spacious. Complimentary buffet breakfast in the morning (fruit salad, cereal, baked goodies, toast+jam/peanut butter, instant oatmeal, coffee, tea) was good. Location was pretty good -- only a 5-minute walk from the Berri-UQAM metro station and bus depot, and about a 10-minute walk to Old Montreal and the Old Port. Lots of restaurants close by, but we usually took the metro up to Crescent anyway. Overall, a great experience, and we would definitely go back to this hotel, especially for a longer duration given the kitchenette (fridge, microwave, oven/stove, coffee maker).

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor " Don't stay here"”
Reviews.Author: meinottawa
Reviews.Content: This had to be one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms are are very low level. The bed is as hard as a rock, Showers only gets low pressure water out of the 5 holes that are not plugged. 6 channels on t.v. Staff are not very aware of their surroundings. You will get I am not sure very often. Oh and they demand a deposit of $250.00 from you over and above the roomrate in case of noise or smoke. Well good luck getting that back, they are professionally trained to come up with any excuse possible to not give your money back. I did a fireworks show in montreal stayed in that hotel, I don't smoke but was told I did, even after arguing that it was my clothes that smelled of smoke I never received my deposit back. Only stay if you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre... but cheap”
Reviews.Author: MrJ0y
Reviews.Content: Located in the very center of downtown Montreal, book to this hotel only if price is the only criteria. Don't bring children, and don't go there in winter. I booked there for a training and brought my wife and toddler, in a 1-bedroom suite. Bad experience. The good: -parking was free during that period; -breakfast included; -2 steps from Berri-UQAM The bad: -suite was placed right in front of a construction site; -thermostats maxed at 20C (68F), so -cold in winter (especially at -15C or 5F); -bad sound and climate isolation (we could see light under the balcony door); -Microwave oven was supposedly included but they only had 4, thus none available; -very few staff (the guy had to quit the front desk to go get a tub cap).

Reviews.Title: “For the Frugal Traveller - Great price, place and service”
Reviews.Author: TorontonianBusiness
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the room and service of this property. It is centrally located and steps away from Berri-Uqam subway station. We recommend this property for those travelling on a budget. The Staff were very helpful and always smiled.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Azorion
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an inexpensive hotel in a location convenient to visiting Old Montreal, this is it. Only steps away from the Berri-Uqam Metro hub, you can leave your hotel room and zip off in either of 4 directions on the subway. Also within easy walking distance of Old Montreal, this is a great spot to stay at a bargain price (we paid $260 dollars for 2 nights of hotel and parking) and still have convenient access to the city. The neighborhood north of the hotel is a little sketchy and we didn't find any restaurants nearby that looked appetizing, but with such easy access to the rest of the city by Metro or walking, this wasn't an issue. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, capable of quick service in either French or English. The room was clean, bright and warm. The bed was extremely firm, but comfortable enough and the kitchen equipment was in good repair, if a little dated. There is a fair bit of traffic noise that comes from the busy intersection below the hotel, but being from Toronto this was not a problem for us. The parking garage is located right next to the hotel and accessible by swiping your room car to enter. If you have a larger car, the ramp may be difficult to negotiate, but the garage is not busy so you can take your time doing so. All in all, a good value. If you want a 4 star hotel directly next to gourmet restaurants, stay somewhere else. If you're looking for a clean, inexpensive place to stay, from which you can easily explore the city, book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Beds not very good..”
Reviews.Author: barbara65uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Roberval for a few days and although the room was big enough for four of us, the beds very uncomfortable and seemed to be coming apart at the bottom. The towels were so thin I wouldn't have used them as dishcloths!! The parking was around the corner to the hotel, so that wasn't good having to lug the cases ourselves, but they must have changed the system in August as there was a guard on duty in the car park and we had to pay him upfront for the days the car was booked in for in cash. The staff were friendly enough and breakfast wasn't too bad with lots of choice and decent coffee. The location is good for getting into town by foot, but it is noisy at night. If they were to give the rooms a bit of a 'facelift' and buy some decent beds,then I think it would be a lot better here. Our TV worked alright but there wasn't anything to indicate use of dishes anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “not clean- uncomfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: azad_h
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were mean. The hotel was not clean. Towels were dirty, hair on the bath tub. The hotel staff didn't speak English. I asked for extra towels and I got a dirty pillow instead. The parking was so unsafe and scary. The parking was in another building and I had to carry my luggage all the way to the hotel. I was very unhappy about my stay and I do not recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and ideal for a no-nonsense stay”
Reviews.Author: Magicnumero
Reviews.Content: Forget what some of the reviews on this place will tell you; for the price, this place is just fine. I stayed for four nights in June while attending the F1 race at the circuit Gilles Villeneuve. There is some noise from the major thoroughfares that the hotel is located on, but then that's the price you pay for good transport connections. The Berri metro station is just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel and from there you can reach all parts of Montreal in a matter of minutes. The kitchenette in the room was well equipped and idea for storing and preparing simple snacks. There are a range of shops nearby and the IGA is just a few blocks away. The complimentary breakfast was truly excellent, probably the best I've experienced at any North American hotel. Most of the staff, all of the staff were friendly and so helpful, even with my novice attempts at speaking French! All in all, as long as you are in town to actually enjoy Montreal and not live in a hotel room, this place offers great service and facilities in an excellent location for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: littleone3009
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to go to Montreal and Le Roberval was one of the only hotels available. Was a little worried after reading some of the reviews but decided to give it a chance. Got there much earlier than we could get into our room, but were checked in and given access to the parking garage ($15/day). The parking garage is behind the hotel across the street - there are a few spots in front of the hotel for you to load and unload. The parking garage is very tight - if you're driving anything bigger than a small SUV you might be in trouble. While we waited we walked down to Old Montreal - only about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. The front desk staff were very helpful, took the time to show us everywhere we wanted to go on a map. The room wasn't bad at all - a little old but more like a small apartment than a hotel room. Very clean as well. Had no toiletries in the bathroom but went to the front desk and were given them immediately. Shower is more like a water cannon, but at least the water was hot, and it's better than having no pressure. The kitchen has dishes for you to use - there is a sign posted informing you of a $25-$30 charge if you don't wash them yourself. Air conditioner is in the "living room" with the TV (only 2 English channels) and a pull-out. It is very loud, but turning it off or shutting the door was not an option as it was pretty hot that day. Bedroom has no TV in it. Bed is pretty hard, not very comfortable at all unfortunately. We were on the corner of the hotel at a pretty busy intersection, so there is traffic noise as well as a hospital close by. That didn't bother us too much, the bigger problem is that the inside hotel walls are pretty thin, and there were other guests who thought nothing of screaming in the hallways at 3 in the morning. There is wireless internet in the rooms, they give you the password at the front desk. Seemed to work pretty well. Continental breakfast included as well, same as you would expect. Toast, cereal, bagels (Montreal has the best bagels!), fruit, yogurt, coffee and tea. All in all, a pretty good hotel. Couldn't beat the price. It was a little more room than we needed for one night but would be good for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “It sucks in many aspects”
Reviews.Author: RunnerForLife
Reviews.Content: My family visited Montreal for the first time in July 1, 2010. Because we want to feel the real atmosphere of Montreal, we decided to stay at a hotel in Downtown area, and unfortunately we chose Le Roberval which turned out later to be a very bad decision. And here are some of the reasons.. 1. It is REALLY noisy!! I am usually not picky of the quietness of hotels but this hotel is beyond any tolerance of mine. It is noisy all night. I was waken up many times during the night due to the traffic outside. I closed all windows tight, but it's just useless. 2. Unsatisfied service: When checking in, we told the clerk that we would like a QUIET room, so we preferred rooms in higher levels. When we pulled our luggage to the 5th floor ( by the way, the highest floor is 6th floor), we found our room was facing a major road, and actually, the room was located at the corner of the intersection of two busy roads! The room's very noisy day and night. :-( 3. Over-charging: when we checked out, the bill charged us $60 for two nights parking (before taxes), and the price should be $15 per night. The clerk refunded us after we found out this issue, but he didn't show any apologies at all. Even $15 per night is quite expensive, since the parking is in a different location and you have to pull your luggage cross the street to the hotel. The parking site is quite small, you'd better to be a good driver to park there. 4. The rooms and the building have some stale smell, everything in our room is quite old. TV is not working ( yes, you can turn it on, but the image is as blur as the most strange paintings in the art gallery in downtown. The screen of the TV is very tiny too, I have not seen a TV which looks that shabby for more than 20 years!) There is no shampoo. And it even charges you $25 if you use the dishes and don't wash it yourself! The only thing decent in this hotel is the breakfast. The food is not bad, and there are many choices of food. Avoid this hotel if possible, or you might feel regretful for your money as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Extra charge for not washing the dishes!”
Reviews.Author: kfarbod
Reviews.Content: We had a kitchenette in our rooms and as usual we used the dishes and left them dirt in the sink. When we came back to our room after morning cleaning, we were surprised that how come they didn't wash the dishes. But we didn't acre and we washed them our self. On the day of checkout we left some dirty dishes in the sink. Now I see that the hotel charged my credit card $28.22 for not washing the dishes. Ridiculous! If you go to any other hotel, they do the dishes without saying anything. It is part of their service. The hotel managers don't have right to charge their guests for these nonsense reasons and even $28.22?!! How many hours did it take for a poor maid that get paid less than $10, to wash my dishes?

Reviews.Title: “avoid the place like the plague”
Reviews.Author: takama
Reviews.Content: stayed in the hotel for a diabetic conference (international!!) in sept. 2009. was told on arrival that only a room in the cellar was available inspite of our advance booking. had to lug our luggage all the way down 2 flights of stairs and back up again. toilet was jammed and not working. plus points : polite staff, the basement room was HUGE could be more useful if we were a group of 8 people maybe. otherwise location wise good with metro station nearby and lot of food joints in walking distance. definitely good value if you consider it is 2 star

Reviews.Title: “Convenience with the "in" prefix”
Reviews.Author: Pitenana
Reviews.Content: The place sucks in too many dimensions to list them all, but I'll try. 1) The nightly noise is beyond horrible. Windows face the main street where traffic never ends, with abundant honkers and ambulance/police sirens thrown in for good measure. 2) The location is tolerable but doesn't qualify for "good". The Old City is half an hour of walking away, and there are no convenience stores or decent eateries anywhere around. 3) Our room had an A/C blasting right above the kid's sofa, essentially rendering it useless. The bathroom was pathetically small, the curtain leaked, and I can't quite compose myself to describe what the place smelled like. 4) Do not repeat our mistake and fall for the advertising that mentions a garage. It is located 5 minutes away from the hotel, and will be charged separately at a rate of $15 a day (FYI, private lot charges $10). 5) Free WiFi connection (which actually lured us in) required a re-login every 20 minutes. It might be fine if you need it for emails and news but forget anything else. 6) Continental breakfast sucks anywhere, anytime, and Le Roberval was no exception. The only redeeming quality was kind, decent, and good looking staff at the reception. They even spoke English pretty well, a rarity in Montreal. All in all, get a decent room in a network hotel closer to the Old city or, failing to afford that, find a cheaper, cleaner, and/or quieter place.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL WITH BREKFAST AND CLEAN ROOMS AND FREE PARKING IN THE HEART OF MONTREAL”
Reviews.Author: marcqwan
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in Downtown of Montreal , with free brekfast and free parking , close to restaurant , clubs and bar aria , clean and with friendly staff , I am looking forward for my next trip to Mmontreal to stay at Le roberal :)

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: BBALL77
Reviews.Content: My stay was way above my expectations. First of all I have to say that the customer service was exceptional! From the reception staff to the breakfast and housekeeping staff, everybody was extremely helpful and welcoming. When I arrived, my room wasn't yet ready (which was to be expected). Nonetheless, I was able to check in anyway when my room was half and hour later. My room was perfect. Very comfortable and highly clean The staff were incredibly nice and professional and made the whole stay very relaxing. For some reason my card was deactivated when we returned to my room, however the housekeeping lady immediately let me into my room (upon identity confirmation), called down to reception and had a porter bring me new card. Again, great customer service. Overall, I had an amazing weekend and I highly recommend le Roberval..!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, would go back anytime”
Reviews.Author: klodya
Reviews.Content: I have stayed only one night at Le Roberval and my experience was very satisfying. I wanted a room with a separate bedroom and there are VERY few hotels who offer this choice at such a low price. Indoor parking and breakfast were included with our reservation, which is always appreciated. The hotel is located 2 minutes away from the Berri-UQAM metro station, a very central spot. Nothing too fancy, but good beds, clean place, and the suite is similar to an appartment with everything necessary to make your own food if you like. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “up to my expectations !”
Reviews.Author: taba1
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay for 2 nights with my husband and my 4 years old son on Jan/2010 I had to say that my stay at Le Roberval was wonderful. The price for 2 nights was great considering the fact that it had the parking and the breakfast included ($218 taxes included) The room (who had a kitchennette) and the rest of the facilites were very clean, the people really friendly I would definately come back there !!!

Reviews.Title: “3 sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: warlocktoronto
Reviews.Content: So It was said that I`d have a kitchnete adn I had it, but thingk about trailer park kitchen and you can get the idea. NO ice trays in the fridge and no ice machine in the ``hotel`` plus you have to pay extra 25 to have dishes done I always travel on a budget but I have never been in a hotel where there where 2 human hairs waiting for me in the bath tube. Them the corridors are covered in tytle therefore any woman wearing heels seemed to be stomping inside my bedroom. Being a cheap hotel atracts a cheap clientele that has no respect for other people`s need to rest and they come yieling and screaming at any hour and the staff doesn`t bother to do something. I have no idea how it is rated 3 stars as evrything is so run down. Internet use is trough a cable that you have to pick up at the front desk It just goes from bad to worse

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ProwlerSF
Reviews.Content: No complaints. An awful lot of furniture in the room and a ceiling fan would be nice. Staff, location, amenities, cleanliness all fine. Nothing fancy, not "quaint" or even really modern, but a good place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Suite with barely adequate air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: CtUkie
Reviews.Content: Suite was clean but spare. Pictures on internet are misleading - suite appears larger and more spacious than it is (wide angle lens). Suite has one wall air conditioner in bedroom to service the whole suite. A/C noisy. Wireless internet access promised does not exist. Wired internet broken; staff was called, and eventually on second day, wired internet repaired. Front desk staff placed a credit card hold of $100 on my credit card, but failed to advise me that it was hotel policy. Maid service was not done until the third day of a 3 day stay. Not a good value for service received. I've traveled to Montreal for years, and, for the price, there are many other options with better accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RoxyT
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what people are talking about. This Hotel is perfect! Very clean, excellent location & never experienced any problems. It's walking distance to many attractions & the "Metro" (subway). I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatricyaLyon
Reviews.Content: I had a very bad experience. They are very materialist. they wouldn't consider you as a person. all they interest them is to make you pay more. Bad rooms Bad service Bad everything Patricya

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aleks20
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at Le Roberval for a long weekend ... Our rooms was great; full kitchen (large fridge, stove/over, microwave, sink, cupboards with pots/pans/plates), dining table in kitchen. The bathroom was basic, but VERY clean. The only downside was the fact that we were expecting two beds, but there was only one in the room which didn't bother us at all since we're close friends. This hotel does not have the "typical tacky decor" seen in most cheaper hotels ... the bedroom had an exposed brick wall and a wrought iron bedframe; very "european" look to it. The staff were very friendly, the free breakfast was basic, but good. Another big plus about this hotel is that it is downtown; a very short walk to the nightlife/clubs/bars/restaurants. I would definitely return to this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Priced Right, Close To Everything”
Reviews.Author: TravelTorontoONtario
Reviews.Content: After a lengthy search to find a CLEAN, place to stay for the weekend I decided on the Roberval, being from Montreal I wanted a central place to stay close to the Metro but foremost CLEAN, The Roberval did not disappoint me. We had 2 quad rooms, there were 8 of us, going to see the Habs play Toronto. Both rooms had 2 double beds, your typical TV, bathroom, chair. writing table, and an additional sink with limited cutlery. Which was fine I did not plan on cooking, I noticed they had had outlets for a stove in both rooms but both stoves had been taken out. The hotel is now dedicated to Non smoking, on every floor. The parking is $15.00 per night but is in a secured underground parking area. The breakfast was included each morning from 7-10 for all occupants, it was bagels yogurt toast cereal coffee tea orange juice. Not bacon and eggs but enough to keep you happy and on your way. The hotel is walking distance to St. Catherines as well as many attractions. The casino (I would take my vehicle there is about 15 minutes away, the front desk will give you a map to get you there if you ask). The metro which is an excellent underground subway system is in walking distance from the hotel.. We got a day pass unlimited for $9.00 each. We took the Metro to the Bell Centre, we preferred to just keep our car in the hotel parking since it can be a bit dicy getting a parking spot in Montreal, and we would just have to pay for additional parking anyway. The cost for each room was $125.00 plus tax. Compared to other hotels I had had my friends (who still reside in Montreal check out) this was by far the best. Something I should add is I hate the way usual hotel rooms have carpeting everywhere and who knows what has been on it. At the Roberval a good portion of it was tiling which is good especially if you have allergies. The limited carpeting that was on the floor was immaculate. I know other reviews have said that it was not quite what they expected and I can see by the pictures on the web site it had to have been prior to the renovation which was going on in the small lobby when we arrived. But if you want a CLEAN, well located hotel and don't want to pay $200.00 per night for a bed to sleep in this should be your pick. When we first approached the entrance it almost looked like an apartment and the lobby is a bit on the small side, but we were not there to hang around a lobby nor were we there to sit in a hotel bar (which they do not have), we were there to sleep and go out and enjoy the night life of Montreal. I hope your stay is as pleasant as our was, we could not have asked for anything better. I have told my friends in Toronto about this hotel and will be making this hotel my place to stay anytime I am in Montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there, they are cheats and liers”
Reviews.Author: hello123Jk
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for a 3 night stay through Hotels.com over the phone and asked specifically that time to the agent while booking if the parking was included because parking is ridiculously priced in Montreal and can be very expensive. I was specifically told multiple times by the representative that it is included with the cost of renting the rooms and Iwould not be charged anything extra for it. I was told multiple times since I asked multiple times specifically about the parking charges. Anyways when I went to Montreal to rent the room, I was told my Mr, Samuel who was sitting on the front desk that night, that the parking charges were not included in my hotel stay and I would have to pay extra for it; when I explained to him that I was told so specifically by the booking agent that the parking is included in the cost of renting the room, this guy agreed to it and told me it's not a problem and he would put that in the contract and I wouldn't have to pay any extra for it. Total lie! When I was checking out at the end of my 3 night stay there the front desk person tells me that I owe them $51 extra for the parking charges in additon to the room charges that were already paid and they would charge my credit card for that. When I interrupted her and told that I was assured during my check in by the front desk person that the parking charges will not be charged extra she says she is not aware of any such thing and they are entitled to being paid for the parking charges. When I asked to be spoken to with the person who checked me in she tell me that he is not here now. After much deliberation and wait I was made to talk to a supervisior on the phone who kept repeating the same thing. When I asked to speak to her in person she maid me wait > 30 min in the lobby and when she did come she said the same statement as she uttered over the phone. When I asked her to speak to htis Samuel guy for clarifying the matter myself, she said she would tak to him herself when he comes back to work that night. when I asked her to call me about the results of her discussion with her later that day she said she would and she even took down by number. She also said she would not charge my credit card till she speaks t o this guy. Anyways, the outome of the matter, she never called me back,though I expected at least a courtesy call from her and after a month of my stay there, I see my credit card being charged for their exorbitant parking charges. The name of their supervisor was Viviane. I advise anyone going to Montreal to be aware of this parking scam where they make try desperately to make more money; And if you have to pay for it, you can use other open garages that are much cheaper and/or stay in a better hotel that would charge for the parking but at least would have better services. Total liers/crooks.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible - Spend the Extra Money and Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: steve_krysak
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I stayed here with 5 friends at the end of August of 2008. We loved the idea of the family suites where we could all stay in the same unit together. We should have went with two rooms at a Best Western. When we go there we were immediately a little disappointed.. the room was very dim and not as large as advertised. Only one bathroom as well. The floor was cold and the bathroom didn't steamed up very quickly. Since we thought we were getting a good deal we let that slide. The next day we realized that staff didn't come and clean the rooms, once again we let that slide. We asked for more towels, none came. Let that one slide too. We were in Montreal having a good time and didn't want the hotel to ruin it. We checked out at the end of our trip and thought that would be the end of it. About a week after we left my credit card was charged for an extra 141 dollars. After calling the hotel I was informed that this was for: a) a 25 dollar charge for leaving dishes in the sink b) a 100 dollar charge for a leak in the bathroom. Now, if you were paying 800 dollars for three nights at a hotel room, would you not expect that if you left a few cups in the sink that would be alright? We saw no documentation of this charge. As for the leak in the bathroom, we had been having troubles with our toliet for the entire stay and had mentioned this to them on check out, but alas, that doesn't matter apparently. When I called them they repeatedly denied that we told them about the leak or that there was no documentation of the dish rule present in the rooms. I've found their staff very difficult to deal with and would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Spring for one of the other hotel's in the area. The rooms will be nicer, the service better, and you won't wind up with a whole lot of stress after your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but only smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: Casina_di_Rosa
Reviews.Content: The room was large and had a clean kitchenette. The only problem is that I booked a non smoking room to find out that most rooms are for smokers and so we also got one. It was clean, but the smell was terrible. We had found a last minute offer so the price was good and the location is amazing but I would not stay there again unless I have a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Super value”
Reviews.Author: boule
Reviews.Content: Very clean and large room. Good location near interesting attractions. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: ukNY
Reviews.Content: We drove from NYC for an Independence Day vacation, stayed for 3 nights. Overall, if you did some traveling in large cities you know that you can't expect anything special from $140/night hotel. You get what you pay for - basic (and hopefully) no-nosense service. Good things about Roberval: location - couple of block walk to Rue St Denis (and the rest of Latin Quarter) colorful restaurants/shopping, 5 min drive to Old City; rooms - we had a clean suite w/ kitchen, tiny bedroom and sofa/pull-down-bed in another room; breakfast - fresh and nice: croissants, bagels, coffee, fruit salad; no problem service - rooms cleaned (garbage taken, towels changed, sheets changed), girls downstairs always friendly. Kitchen was Ok - gas oven, fridge, no dirty plates or pots as others wrote (even though we brought our own little pot - just in case). Oh, had we known that smoker rooms had balconies we would have opted for one. Not so good: underground parking ($15) is in the building accross the street/around the corner - very annoying b/c you do need a car to move around Montreal (not exactly a tiny city); TV - old tiny hardly visible, 15 louzy channels (half French); view - on the parking or a street, nothing to write about.

Reviews.Title: “some glitches-but ironed out!!”
Reviews.Author: skykid
Reviews.Content: over all a good value but webooked it thru the quebec wayside booth and found they had wanted 15 extra for our daughter to stay even though we had a reservation printed for 3!! i insisted we hold firm and they did that but what a hassle entering after a long drive and getting the stonewall there! not professional- the night staff. we liked the clean rooms but were upset that the kitchen was there and that we had to clean the cups and coffee maker or not get our 250 usd deposit back! good location for the village, old port and china town the metro is right behind ! oh and the parking is very compact so if you are bigger truck use another lot! good breakfast and coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: georockgal
Reviews.Content: Overall stay was a pleasant one. The staff were helpful and friendly. We booked our hotel in Montreal this time based on price and location (we were heading to the Jacques Villeneuve circuit the next day) and kept in mind that it was only going to be used for one night to lay our heads. This was a good choice for that. It is in the vicinity of the University of Quebec, and must have been residences during the school year or something because each room was a mini-suite that came with a separate bedroom and bathroom from the kitchen and living room area. We ended up having to switch rooms 3 times because the first room had no working air conditioning and the second room had the same plus there was work being done to the stove and kitchen area (they should have really check on this room before we tried it). Once we got settled into our third room, it was deemed satisfactory, a working airconditioner, appliances and clean bathroom. The TV remote needed a change in batteries but then again we were not spending lots of time there. Outside the building was a little shady in that the buildings around it were a little dilapitated and when you walked up to St. Catherine street, there were quite a few homeless people close by. But being at the corner of Beri St and Rene Levesque we were very close to shopping on St Catherine St, St Denis St. and St Laurent where there are many great cafes and restaurants to choose from. One restaurant on St Catherine we enjoyed was called De Giovanni's where they served awesome pasta. They must make it fresh daily, and you should see the meatballs!! Here is a review: http://restomontreal.ca/restaurants/index.php?section=viewresto&resto_id=601&show=ratings&lang=en We only paid $92 for the night and got a huge continental breakfast included with the price in the basement floor of their building in a little cafe restaurant. Served was juice and coffee, hot/cold cereal, yogurt, real Montreal bagels with jam or cream cheese, toast, fruit salad muffins. A real tasty treat first thing in the morning! Advice: don't settle ont he first room you get, there are also hotels int he area like the Hotel Lord Berri and another around the corner that are all part of the same company but I think a slight bit more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: 135wamsw
Reviews.Content: The concpet of a kitchen in the hotel room is great but if it is not cleaned it is a disgusting idea. It does not make any sense to pay extra money to have a kitchen cleaned and it makes even less sense to not clean it at all. The room was big and comfortable, but we had to kill some bugs when we were there. I am now having trouble sleeping in my own bed becuase when I returned home from this vacation with a rash I learned that these were bed bugs and now fear that my own home is invested with this disgusting insect. I will never stay at this hotel again and if anyone reading this decides to stay here I would suggest not staying in room 510 becuase the couch is infested with bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Sue&mike
Reviews.Content: We crossed the border from the States into Canada and called at the Tourist info. They were very helpful and booked us into this hotel. We were a little worried about the distance from the centre and the external appearance. However once inside we were pleasantly suprised, helpful reception. Our room came complete with fully equipped kitchen, the room was basic but very clean and a good size. The walk into central Montreal was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: lover
Reviews.Content: Cute very very clean hotel, full kitchen in the rooms and table and chairs. Breakfast was ok but you have to stay in the small breakfast room and eat instead of going to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: luvquebec
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Le Roberval on two occasions and have a reservation for a weekend in November. The hotel is located in the Latin Quartier near the UQAM-Berri subway. The suites are nice with hardwood floors, exposed brick walls and plenty of windows and nice little kitchenettes. Most recently my bedroom was located on the front of the bldg but it was quiet since the rooms are soundproofed with double windows. I used to stay at the Gouverneur Place Dupuis just down the street and the prices there just keep escalating. Le Roberval also has apts for those who need a place for longer stays. I highly recommend this establishment for the great location, price and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bunk666
Reviews.Content: Hi, i recently stayed at the Hotel Le Roberval (August 23-26). The place had good value for your money. The rooms were comfortable, and clean. The kitchenette didn't have a lot of plates and such, but was good enough. The hotel is located in a good area, close to many of the popular streets. The area was safe--there was no hesitation to walk around at night. I would reccomend the hotel, and plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Le Roberval twice, most recently in April 2004. Lots of good things about it. The location is outstanding (it's on a quiet corner, yet is only one long block from the busiest Metro station in Montreal, and walking distance to the lively Quartier Latin to the north and even Chinatown to the west). I believe all the rooms are studios...roomy, with kitchenettes (including a large refrigerator). The staff is very pleasant and helpful. It's not perfect....towels were very worn and linty, for example....but if you can get a good rate, it's an excellent value.

HotelInfo.Name: Le Roberval
HotelInfo.Address: 505 Rene Levesque East, Montreal, Quebec H2L 5B6, Canada
